gw.api.policy.refresh

Class DefaultMatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.bean.compare.MatcherBase<KeyableBean>
      • gw.api.policy.refresh.DefaultMatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityMatcher<KeyableBean>

    public class DefaultMatcher
extends MatcherBase<KeyableBean>
    The default matcher uses every non-link property to compare the two beans: if all property values are equal, then the entities match. This is rarely the desired behavior, so generally you will want to configure a custom matcher.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Prioritizes matches based on whether or not the bean toBeMatched has either a AddressBookUID or a PolicySystemID.

    • Method Detail

      • doEntitiesMatch

        public boolean doEntitiesMatch(KeyableBean source,
                               KeyableBean compare)
        Extracts all data properties from source and compare and compares them. Returns false if any property value is not equal between the two.
        Parameters:
        source - The source entity
        compare - The entity against which the source is compared
        Returns:
        If they match
        See Also:
        gw.api.diff.BeanMatcher

      • getMatchPrioritizer

        public java.util.Comparator<KeyableBean> getMatchPrioritizer(KeyableBean toBeMatched)
        Prioritizes matches based on whether or not the bean toBeMatched has either a AddressBookUID or a PolicySystemID.
        Parameters:
        toBeMatched - The bean that is being matched on the existing Policy
        Returns:
        The match prioritizer
